author: dimitri777
title: Onboard Freelancers to any projects
description: We cannot afford to hire full time staff but must rely on freelancers to fulfill the various roles of our social and charitable projects

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer intended to create a blockchain utility tool for:
- work shift management allow freedom for freelancers to register and swap shift
- transparent payment system
- scheduling delivery route
This tool will be released for the community to use and it can be applied in many other businesses. I find this part aligns well with the challenge settings because of its versatile application.
The team highlights the benefits of integrating blockchain technology into the tool including Transparency, Trackability and Auditability.
The team did a great job at providing an example on how the system intended to work. This project is ambitious, but if it succeeds, it will lay a good foundation for furture blockchain integrated business applications
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding Feasibility, there is a timeline described although most detail is about how to prepare for the food delivery such as: establish connection with restaurants, beneficiary location or carbon credits. I suggest the team to provide more information about the development of the application.
The team enlists 2 separate budgets. One is $29650 will be used for operational tasks and the other is $20000 for the development. The total sum of budget breakdown exceeds the requested budget which is $31650. Perhaps the team could elaborate more on this part.
The team's background and experience are diverse and fit well with the project. However, they need to provide creditable source since it's difficult to verify these information when the team is located in a thirdworld country
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of Auditability, the proposer provided a list of KPIs tracking data of the whole operation. Because the success metrics of the challenge are quite broad and different on case by case basis. In this case, the performance of the operation could be good indicators of a successful project. Therefore, I agree that the metrics the team mentioned are suitable. My only suggestion would be separating KPIs for operational performance and application performance.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is extremely well-written and informative, which gives a really possible solution to address this problem. This project will accelerate Carnado’s growth thanks to the creative measure to solve these concerns. Furthermore, the authors provide much useful information by carefully writing detailed solutions and problems to prove the feasibility of the given solution.  Considering the advantages and disadvantages of hiring freelancers, come up with the most effective solution for this problem. This project is highly recommended.
f6_assessments.q1: I have nothing but impressed by how elaborate the details that authors have provided. Every section is elaborately written to address the problem in detail. The amount of supplied information is easily comprehended. It is noticeable how the specific timeline of this project operates and how a detailed budget is used during the operating phase. Many teammates will help increase the proportion of success thanks to partners' knowledge fields. It is impressive how the proposers structure the goals to keep track on the project’s development.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no doubt that this project will be highly successful because of which factors measure the progress and growth of the project. However, each component should have more explanation to witness the possibility of each element. There should be more explanations are also required in the criteria of success.

f6_assessments.q0:
I spent some time reading and trying to get the overall idea. I think it is some copy and paste from a very well described food chain issue solvable with a generic blockchain. Anyway, it doesn't match the title "onboard freelancers to any projects" because it is not about the food chain. It doesn't match with the "Problem statement". It doesn't match with the section "Summarize your solution to the problem". It finally doesn't match with the "Open Source development", there is not a single word about open source in the entire proposal.
I also can't believe also it matches all of these (17!!) SDG goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
I was not able to understand previous experiences in the opensource space. It is also not even clear what component is open.
The budget is clear and the price per hour is reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: The description is definitely clear and extensive. If it matches the challenge not for sure. It is possible to audit because the number of deliveries/food sent is trackable.

solution: A system where  project can establish transparency of team members doing various roles join on a shift basis and be paid for the shifts.
